meanings.definition: Distribute (resources or wealth) differently or again.
meanings.sent1: The teacher decided to redistribute the crayons so that each student had an equal amount.
meanings.sent2: The government plans to redistribute wealth to help those in need.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally tried to redistribute the cookies, but ended up dropping them all on the floor!
meanings.sent4: The wind seemed to redistribute the fallen leaves across the yard like a painter's brush.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick was to redistribute the cards in a way that amazed the audience.

meanings.definition: To divide up and give out in shares.
meanings.sent1: The charity organization will redistribute the donated food to families in need.
meanings.sent2: It is important to redistribute the tasks evenly among team members.
meanings.sent3: I had to redistribute the candies among the children to make sure everyone got some.
meanings.sent4: The leader decided to redistribute the responsibilities among the team for better efficiency.
meanings.sent5: The chef's job was to redistribute the ingredients to create a balanced meal.
